question: an open-source clone of unix created in the early 1990s
vanilla_rag_result: The passages all refer to an open-source clone of Unix that was created in the early 1990s. This likely points to the operating system known as Linux, which was developed by Linus Torvalds and released in 1991. Linux is a widely used open-source operating system that has become a major alternative to proprietary Unix systems.
